title: Tate & Lyle Shares Surge on Sweetener Unit Deal Talks
sub_head: Food and ingredients maker in talks to sell division for $1.66 billion
body:
Tate & Lyle PLC shares rose as much as 7% on Monday after the food and ingredients maker said it was in talks to sell most of its primary products division.
The announcement from Tate & Lyle came after the Sunday Telegraph reported it has held talks on auctioning the artificial sweetener-making unit off for Â£1.2 billion, equivalent to $1.66 billion, possibly to a private-equity firm.
